text: Eduardo Usabiaga y Ocharán (1891–1973) was a Cuban diplomat. == Career == *After high school he moved to the United States, where he learned English and French and devoted himself to his business. *On June 17, 1925 he joined the Foreign Service. *From 1925 to 1928 he was Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary of Cuba in Santiago de Chile. *From 1928 to 1930 he was Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary in Prague with concurrent accreditation in Warsaw, Bucharest and Belgrade in the Kingdom of Serbs Croats and Slovenes. *In 1931 he was Under Secretary of State in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Cuba). *In 1932 he was Chief of Protocol in Havana.Almanach de Gotha, Band 169, Justus Perthes, 1932, p. 861 * From 1933 to 1935 he was Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary in Paris.edited James Dunkerley, British documents on foreign affairs: Part 3. From 1940 through 1945. Series D. Latin America. South and Central America, July 1944 - December 1944 Volume 9, Univ. Publ. of America, 1999 - 339 pp.,p. 221 == References == Category:1891 births Category:1973 deaths Category:Ambassadors of Cuba to Chile Category:Ambassadors of Cuba to Czechoslovakia Category:Ambassadors of Cuba to France Category:Ambassadors of Cuba to Poland Category:Ambassadors of Cuba to Yugoslavia Category:Ambassadors of Cuba to Romania Category:Cuban expatriates in the United States
title: Eduardo Usabiaga y Llaguno
